byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta reported from New York, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Damascus, Syria.
byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and ANNE BARNARD

abstract: United Nations says it plans to move forward with peace talks between Syrian rebels and government of Pres Bashar al-Assad in January 2016, signal that ongoing military victories and defeats will not affect process.
lead_paragraph: United Nations officials appeared to be signaling that the negotiations would not be affected by gains and losses on the battlefield.

headline.main: U.N. Sets Syrian Peace Talks as Fighting Complicates Task
headline.print_headline: Syrian Peace Talks Set, but Obstacles Remain

snippet: United Nations officials appeared to be signaling that the negotiations would not be affected by gains and losses on the battlefield.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
